DOC.brief_title: A Self-efficacy Enhancing Stroke Self-management Program Community-dwelling Stroke Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: Previous systematic review show theory-based stroke self-management program potential benefit improve stroke survivor ' quality life self-efficacy . However lack evidence evaluate effectiveness nurse-led theory-based stroke self-management program among community-dwelling Chinese stroke survivor . This parallel group , single-blinded , randomize control trial hold community center . All participant assess two time-points ( baseline randomization , one month program completion ) . Eligible participant randomly allocate either control group ( receive usual care ) intervention group ( receive self-efficacy enhance stroke self-management program ) . Participants intervention group receive additional assessment usefulness program immediately program completion .
